verses.text: The \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that came to \w Joel|strong="H3100"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Pethuel|strong="H6602"\w*.

\w Hear|strong="H8085"\w* this, ye old \w men|strong="H2205"\w*, and give \w ear|strong="H0238"\w*, all ye \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*. Hath this been in your \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, or \w even|strong="H0518"\w* in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of your \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*?

\w Tell|strong="H5608"\w* ye your \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of it, and \add let\add* your \w children|strong="H1121"\w* \add tell\add* their \w children|strong="H1121"\w*, and their \w children|strong="H1121"\w* \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w generation|strong="H1755"\w*.

That which the \w palmerworm|strong="H1501"\w* hath \w left|strong="H3499"\w* hath the \w locust|strong="H0697"\w* \w eaten|strong="H0398"\w*; and that which the \w locust|strong="H0697"\w* hath \w left|strong="H3499"\w* hath the \w cankerworm|strong="H3218"\w* \w eaten|strong="H0398"\w*; and that which the \w cankerworm|strong="H3218"\w* hath \w left|strong="H3499"\w* hath the \w caterpiller|strong="H2625"\w* \w eaten|strong="H0398"\w*.\f + \fr 1.4 \ft That which the palmerworm…: Heb. The residue of the palmerworm\f*

\w Awake|strong="H6974"\w*, ye \w drunkards|strong="H7910"\w*, and \w weep|strong="H1058"\w*; and \w howl|strong="H3213"\w*, all ye \w drinkers|strong="H8354"\w* of \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, because of the new \w wine|strong="H6071"\w*; for it is cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* from your \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*.

For a \w nation|strong="H1471"\w* is come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* upon my \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, \w strong|strong="H6099"\w*, and without \w number|strong="H4557"\w*, whose \w teeth|strong="H8127"\w* \add are\add* the \w teeth|strong="H8127"\w* of a \w lion|strong="H0738"\w*, and he hath the cheek \w teeth|strong="H4973"\w* of a great \w lion|strong="H3833"\w*.

He hath \w laid|strong="H7760"\w* my \w vine|strong="H1612"\w* \w waste|strong="H8047"\w*, and \w barked|strong="H7111"\w* my fig \w tree|strong="H8384"\w*: he hath made it \w clean|strong="H2834"\w* \w bare|strong="H2834"\w*, and cast \add it\add* \w away|strong="H7993"\w*; the \w branches|strong="H8299"\w* thereof are made \w white|strong="H3835"\w*.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft barked…: Heb. laid my fig tree for a barking\f*

¶ \w Lament|strong="H0421"\w* like a \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w* \w girded|strong="H2296"\w* with \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w* for the \w husband|strong="H1167"\w* of her \w youth|strong="H5271"\w*.

The meat \w offering|strong="H4503"\w* and the drink \w offering|strong="H5262"\w* is cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* from the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*, the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w ministers|strong="H8334"\w*, \w mourn|strong="H0056"\w*.

The \w field|strong="H7704"\w* is \w wasted|strong="H7703"\w*, the \w land|strong="H0127"\w* \w mourneth|strong="H0056"\w*; for the \w corn|strong="H1715"\w* is \w wasted|strong="H7703"\w*: the new \w wine|strong="H8492"\w* is dried \w up|strong="H3001"\w*, the \w oil|strong="H3323"\w* \w languisheth|strong="H0535"\w*.

Be ye \w ashamed|strong="H3001"\w*, O ye \w husbandmen|strong="H0406"\w*; \w howl|strong="H3213"\w*, O ye \w vinedressers|strong="H3755"\w*, for the \w wheat|strong="H2406"\w* and for the \w barley|strong="H8184"\w*; because the \w harvest|strong="H7105"\w* of the \w field|strong="H7704"\w* is \w perished|strong="H0006"\w*.

The \w vine|strong="H1612"\w* is dried \w up|strong="H3001"\w*, and the fig \w tree|strong="H8384"\w* \w languisheth|strong="H0535"\w*; the \w pomegranate|strong="H7416"\w* tree, the palm \w tree|strong="H8558"\w* also, and the apple \w tree|strong="H8598"\w*, \add even\add* all the \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* of the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, are \w withered|strong="H3001"\w*: because \w joy|strong="H8342"\w* is withered \w away|strong="H3001"\w* from the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w*.

\w Gird|strong="H2296"\w* yourselves, and \w lament|strong="H5594"\w*, ye \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*: \w howl|strong="H3213"\w*, ye \w ministers|strong="H8334"\w* of the \w altar|strong="H4196"\w*: \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, lie all \w night|strong="H3885"\w* in \w sackcloth|strong="H8242"\w*, ye \w ministers|strong="H8334"\w* of my \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: for the meat \w offering|strong="H4503"\w* and the drink \w offering|strong="H5262"\w* is \w withholden|strong="H4513"\w* from the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of your \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

¶ \w Sanctify|strong="H6942"\w* ye a \w fast|strong="H6685"\w*, \w call|strong="H7121"\w* a solemn \w assembly|strong="H6116"\w*, \w gather|strong="H0622"\w* the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* \add and\add* all the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* \add into\add* the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and \w cry|strong="H2199"\w* unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*,  +  r 1.14  t solemn…: or, day of restraint *

\w Alas|strong="H0162"\w* for the \w day|strong="H3117"\w*! for the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* at \w hand|strong="H7138"\w*, and as a \w destruction|strong="H7701"\w* from the \w Almighty|strong="H7706"\w* shall it \w come|strong="H0935"\w*.

Is not the \w meat|strong="H0400"\w* cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* before our \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, \add yea\add*, \w joy|strong="H8057"\w* and \w gladness|strong="H1524"\w* from the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of our \w God|strong="H0430"\w*?

The \w seed|strong="H6507"\w* is \w rotten|strong="H5685"\w* under their \w clods|strong="H4053"\w*, the \w garners|strong="H0214"\w* are laid \w desolate|strong="H8074"\w*, the \w barns|strong="H4460"\w* are broken \w down|strong="H2040"\w*; for the \w corn|strong="H1715"\w* is \w withered|strong="H3001"\w*.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft seed: Heb. grains\f*

How do the \w beasts|strong="H0929"\w* \w groan|strong="H0584"\w*! the \w herds|strong="H5739"\w* of \w cattle|strong="H1241"\w* are \w perplexed|strong="H0943"\w*, because they have no \w pasture|strong="H4829"\w*; yea, the \w flocks|strong="H5739"\w* of \w sheep|strong="H6629"\w* are made \w desolate|strong="H0816"\w*.

O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to thee will I \w cry|strong="H7121"\w*: for the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* hath \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* the \w pastures|strong="H4999"\w* of the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*, and the \w flame|strong="H3852"\w* hath \w burned|strong="H3857"\w* all the \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* of the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*.\f + \fr 1.19 \ft pastures: or, habitations\f*

The \w beasts|strong="H0929"\w* of the \w field|strong="H7704"\w* \w cry|strong="H6165"\w* also unto thee: for the \w rivers|strong="H0650"\w* of \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* are dried \w up|strong="H3001"\w*, and the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* hath \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* the \w pastures|strong="H4999"\w* of the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*.
